website_summaries.verdict: If you can live without a Thunderbolt 3 port, you'll find HP's Envy 13 a stylish alternative to 13.3-inch ultraportables costing hundreds more.
cons: Not suited for gaming despite discrete graphics

customer_reviews.title: Comes with 1TB SSD with premium quality
customer_reviews.text: This is actually comes with 1TB SSD, which was a nice surprise. it works really smooth, and has a good build quality and feels premium. the fan can sometimes become noisy under heavy performance.
customer_reviews.author: Farouk Abbas

customer_reviews.title: Superb.....but
customer_reviews.text: great, i7, 16gb ram, 1tb ssd. perfect for out of office use. One thing to watch out for the hd comes with Bitlocker turned on so many programs will not work with it, go to Control Panel and turn off Bitlocker and its perfect. I always install ClassicShellSetup on my windows 10 machines which gets rid of those horrible tiles and puts the interface back to win 7 without losing any windows 10 bits. Try it, you can always uninstall and its free...yes really free! Last but not least you do not get a licence with the home edition supplied, you have to buy one... I upgraded to win 10 pro.....cost £119 from microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: TAC45

customer_reviews.title: Good performance for the price - some persistent issues
customer_reviews.text: Good laptop for the price, very decent performance, however, it is plagued by some quality issues. The main reason I returned it was the loose touchpad, which would "rattle" around in the bottom part when one puts a finger on top of it, making it very annoying if one uses the touchpad on a regular basis. This, combined with the not so great battery life, made it hard to justify keeping the laptop. Other than that, the screen was okay, with good touch capability, and also the fairly good spec made the laptop handle daily tasks easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Windows 10 Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I have been able to mirror all that I have on my PC at home enabling me to travel and keep up to date on the move. 16gb memory is ahead of the game and with the added plus of 1tb of SSD (not 500gb as advertised) this machine rocks. Great price at just over £1,000 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Bede

customer_reviews.title: Terrible trackpad
customer_reviews.text: The trackpad is rather small, even for a 13", it feels like it is made of a cheap plastic and after a week my trackpad just stopped clicking. Other than that the laptop is great, just HP's quality standards are not, i never should have received such a defective model.
customer_reviews.author: Akio Baudains

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love it, so light to handle, I use it for my crafts..still getting use to that.
customer_reviews.author: Kymmey

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a slight dent in the case, and the software not operating properly. Sent back and I was finally refunded the cash after something of a hassle and delay with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: L.Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and highly efficient
customer_reviews.text: A lovely notebook that's so easy to carry around and does just about anything except very intensive games
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm J. Flight

customer_reviews.title: Returned by me at my cost.  Unit has been received in Fiffe, Please expedite refund.
customer_reviews.text: Not the usual HP quality. Froze in opening screen. Wi fi only worked sometimes. Since bought an HP Pavillion from you. That is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Good performer laptop overall
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy whit my laptop the hinge get loose after 2 months of light usage, not a lap use laptop gonna return it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is fast, light weight and very practical for everyday use
customer_reviews.author: Jo C

customer_reviews.title: Died after 15 months! Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: My Envy died after 15 months, just out of warranty. It was an expensive mistake. Avoid
customer_reviews.author: Barb Evans

product_meta.title: HP Envy 13-aq0000na 13.3-Inch FHD Touch-screen Laptop, Intel Core i5-8265U, 8 GB RAM, 256 GB SSD, NVIDIA GeForce MX250 (2 GB GDDR5 Dedicated) Graphics, Windows 10 Home - Silver
product_meta.description: Size Name:13.3 Inch, i5-8265U, MX250| Style Name:8 GB RAM, 256 GB SSDA sleek PC with an Intel Core processor experience peace of mind, no matter where your day takes you. Light, powerful, and with smart security features – The HP ENVY 33.8 cm (13.3") Laptop is built to empower life on-the-go. With state-of-the-art security, an ultra-sleek design, and powerful entertainment features, your privacy and data stays secure – whether you’re at home or on-the-road.
feature_bullets: Built thin and light for those on the go expect premium design features including a brilliant backlit keyboard, seamless profile and geometric pattern speaker grill
Privacy Camera Kill Switch: Ensure your privacy and security with a physical switch that turns off your PC's camera when not in use, no more unsightly tape to cover your camera lens
Elevate entertainment on a high resolution, 3-way micro-edge display with audio by B&O, the quad HP speakers, custom-tuned in collaboration with experts at B&O, deliver rich, authentic sound
All Metal, Sleek Design, Micro-edge Display: This beautifully efficient design couples an ultra-thin bezel with an edge to edge keyboard, maximising display and keyboard area
HP Fast Charge: When your laptop is low on power, no one has time to wait hours to recharge, power down your device and go from 0 to 50 Percent charge in approximately 45 minutes
